Detailed Description

A Cam3 is a camera that can be used in 3D space.

It has clipping planes in each dimension, calculated using field of view and near/far clipping distance. This in turn produces the viewing frustum. The Cam3 is comaptible with OpenGL.

See also:
Cam
Author:
Ben Constable, original Java code by Oli Winks
Version:
1.0

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Cam3::Cam3 (  ) [inline]

Default constructor.

Default position (0,0,1). Field of view is 45 degrees, near clipping plane is 1 and far clipping plane is 100.

void Cam3::generatePickRay ( float  screenX,
float  screenY,
Vec3 &  pickPos,
Vec3 &  pickDir 
)

Generate a pick ray for the given parameters.

A pick ray allows checking for contact between a point on the physical screen and a point somewhere in 3D space.

Parameters:
screenXscreen x coordinate
screenYscreen y coordinate
pickPospick position
pickDirdirection of screen coordinate to pick position
